snippet: In the early 1920s, Coco Chanel lifted black from its 19th-century association with death to a sophisticated statement with her now-celebrated little black dress. Here are some modern looks.
abstract: Bill Cunningham shares photos of of women and men in and around New York City wearing all black.
lead_paragraph: In the early 1920s, Coco Chanel lifted black from its 19th-century association with death to a sophisticated statement with her now-celebrated little black dress. Here are some modern looks.
